content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #162

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: FHIRcast can just be used by one user to synchronize different apps?

Submitted by Ricardo Quintano Neira
Chapter/section: Overview
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: A-S Clarification

Summary: FHIRcast can just be used by one user to synchronize different apps?

Comment: "The FHIRcast specification describes the APIs and interactions to synchronize healthcare applications in real time to show the same clinical content to a user."

Just one user? Can it not be used for the synchronization between different users (e.g. during a MDT meeting in with each participant is using a different app/mobile)

Existing wording: The FHIRcast specification describes the APIs and interactions to synchronize healthcare applications in real time to show the same clinical content to a user.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #162

Just one user? Can it not be used for the synchronization between different users (e.g. during a MDT meeting in with each participant is using a different app/mobile)

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

NiklasSvenzen commented on Issue #162

Discussed during conversation at the Montreal, May 2019 working group meeting:

Proposed Resolution: Persuasive with mod

Proposed wording: The FHIRcast specification describes the APIs and interactions to synchronize healthcare applications in real time to show the same clinical content to a user or a group of users sharing the same topic.

wmaethner labeled Issue #162:

isaacvetter commented on Issue #162:

## :telephone_receiver: CDS Working Group Vote (5-21-2019)

Meeting notes: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/IMIN/Teleconferences

@NiklasSvenzen moved the following disposition, seconded by Ricardo

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: The FHIRcast specification describes the APIs and interactions to synchronize healthcare applications in real time to show the same clinical content to a user or a group of users sharing the same topic.

:+1: For: 10
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
